title: Manchester City’s 13-year-old defender Finley Burns cost a record £175,000 from Southend

organizations.name: finley burns getty images manchester city

text:
MANCHESTER CITY have paid a record £175,000 to sign 13-year-old wonderkid Finley Burns from Southend United. 
The Premier League giant’s fee could rise to £250,000 depending on his future success. PA:Press Association 4 Pep Guardiola’s City have won the race for 13-year-old Finley Burns 
Liverpool , Chelsea and Arsenal were all interested in the teenager, but the youngster was impressed by what City could offer and their state-of-the-art football academy facility. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip in the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog 
Burns, whose move was revealed by The Times, was free to leave Roots Hall in the summer. 
Despite his age, he was promoted to Southend’s Under-16 side and starred on several occasions to earn his big move. related stories depay the price Lyon president Jean-Michel Aulas says Memphis Depay is chomping at bit to show his 'immense talent' Transfers live All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window MORE POWER Jake Livermore close to £10m switch from Hull as West Brom eye first transfer window deal HORNETS STING Watford close in on deal to bring Fiorentina striker Mauro Zarate on loan until the end of the season 
He will now join City’s academy, who are enjoying success at a number of levels. 
Their U18s beat Liverpool 7-0 earlier in the season while the club’s U15s beat rivals Manchester United 9-0. 
City manager Pep Guardiola is a big fan of promoting youngsters into the first-team fold and that was one of the reasons that swayed Burns and his family’s decision. Getty Images City have shelled out £175k, which could rise to £250k, for Finley Burns Getty Images Manchester City have invested millions into their state-of-the-art academy Reuters 4 Guardiola’s record of promoting young players was a big factor in Burns’ decision 
Southend United’s head of youth, Ricky Duncan, said: “There were four or five Premier League clubs after Finley in the end and it’s extremely difficult to keep hold of a boy once that happens. 
“He would have had a ten-day window of opportunity to look elsewhere at the end of the season so this was the best way to do it. 
“He’s a great kid from a nice family and everything was sorted out amicably which is how it should be. Watch all the Premier League action in our Weekend Premier League round-up 
“We would prefer our best young players to come through and play for our first team but the fact Manchester City are aware of youth players at Southend United reflects very well on what everyone is doing here. 
“Man City could sign anyone from across the world so for them to come to us is a real compliment. 
“We’re still in touch and we wish him all the very best for the future.” Everton 4-0 Manchester City : Everton youngsters shine in easy win against Man City
